m_szDocSumamry: TWEET Auto Shows Are recharging times and limited range keeping you from switching to battery-electric cars? How about a zero-emissions concept car whose electric motors enable it to drive 370 miles, and which then can be refueled in four minutes to do it again? That’s the promise of the Audi h-tron Quattro concept. Heavily based on the Frankfurt auto show’s e-tron Quattro concept —preview for the upcoming Q6, which will offer multiple powertrain options—the h-tron promises clean, quiet driving; all-wheel-drive grip; and a 124-mph top speed. Capable of hitting 62 mph in less than seven seconds
